extendedIngredients.name: broccoli rabe
extendedIngredients.original: 10 cup coarsely chopped broccoli rabe (about 1 [1-pound] bunch)

extendedIngredients.name: canned chickpeas
extendedIngredients.original: 1 (16-ounce) can chickpeas (garbanzo beans), rinsed and drained

extendedIngredients.name: garlic
extendedIngredients.original: 1/2 cup sliced garlic (about 10 to 12 garlic cloves)

extendedIngredients.name: grana padano cheese
extendedIngredients.original: 1/2 cup (2 ounces) grated Grana Padano cheese

extendedIngredients.name: prosciutto
extendedIngredients.original: 1 (3-ounce) prosciutto end piece, cut into (1/4-inch-wide) julienne strips
extendedIngredients.originalName: prosciutto end piece, cut into (1/4-inch-wide) julienne strips

extendedIngredients.name: gomiti
extendedIngredients.original: 1 pound uncooked gomiti (short, curled, tube-shaped pasta)

title: Gomiti with Broccoli Rabe, Chickpeas, and Prosciutto
summary: Gomiti with Broccoli Rabe, Chickpeas, and Prosciutto is a gluten free recipe with 8 servings. For $1.21 per serving, this recipe covers 16% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. One portion of this dish contains around 9g of protein, 13g of fat, and a total of 192 calories. 1 person were impressed by this recipe. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 45 minutes. It is brought to you by My Recipes. If you have broccoli rabe, gomiti, garlic, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. It works well as a reasonably priced side dish. With a spoonacular score of 47%, this dish is solid. Try Pasta With Broccoli Rabe And Chickpeas, Orecchiette With Broccoli Rabe & Chickpeas, and Orecchiette With Chickpeas and Broccoli Rabe for similar recipes.
instructions: Bring 6 quarts water and 2 teaspoons salt to a boil in a large stockpot. Stir in pasta; partially cover, and return to a boil, stirring frequently. Cook 8 minutes or until pasta is almost al dente, stirring occasionally. Drain pasta in a colander over a bowl, reserving 2 cups cooking water.                                                                                                While pasta cooks, heat oil in a Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add garlic and prosciutto; cook 1 minute, stirring constantly. Add pepper; cook 2 1/2 minutes or until prosciutto is crisp, stirring frequently. Add reserved 2 cups cooking water and chickpeas; bring to a boil. Add broccoli rabe (do not stir); cover, reduce heat, and simmer 7 minutes or until broccoli rabe is tender. Uncover; simmer 15 minutes or until liquid almost evaporates. Add pasta, and cook 1 minute or until pasta is al dente, tossing to combine. Remove from heat; stir in cheese. Serve immediately.

steps.step: Bring 6 quarts water and 2 teaspoons salt to a boil in a large stockpot. Stir in pasta; partially cover, and return to a boil, stirring frequently. Cook 8 minutes or until pasta is almost al dente, stirring occasionally.
Drain pasta in a colander over a bowl, reserving 2 cups cooking water.
While pasta cooks, heat oil in a Dutch oven over medium-high heat.
Add garlic and prosciutto; cook 1 minute, stirring constantly.
Add pepper; cook 2 1/2 minutes or until prosciutto is crisp, stirring frequently.
Add reserved 2 cups cooking water and chickpeas; bring to a boil.
Add broccoli rabe (do not stir); cover, reduce heat, and simmer 7 minutes or until broccoli rabe is tender. Uncover; simmer 15 minutes or until liquid almost evaporates.
Add pasta, and cook 1 minute or until pasta is al dente, tossing to combine.
Remove from heat; stir in cheese.
